HTMLTableColElement.summary: The HTMLTableColElement interface provides properties for manipulating single or grouped table column elements.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: col and colgroup.

HTMLTableColElementAlign.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The align property of the interface is a string indicating how to horizontally align text in a table {{htmlelement("col")}} column element.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated, and CSS should be used to align text horizontally in a column. Use the CSS text-align property, which takes precedence, to horizontally align text in a column instead.

As td are not children of col, you can't set it directly on a col element, you need to select the cells of the column using a td:nth-last-child(n) or similar (n is the column number, counting from the end).

HTMLTableColElementCh.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The ch property of the interface does nothing. It reflects the char attribute of the col element.

blockquote.para: This property was designed to participate to the ability to align table cell content on a specific character (typically the decimal point), but was never implemented by browsers.
To achieve such alignment, watch for the support of a string value with the text-align CSS property.

HTMLTableColElementChOff.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The chOff property of the interface does nothing. It reflects the charoff attribute of the col element.

blockquote.para: This property was designed to participate in an ability to align table cell content on a specific character (typically the decimal point), but was never implemented by browsers.
To achieve such alignment, watch for the support of a string value with the text-align CSS property.

HTMLTableColElementSpan.summary: The span read-only property of the interface represents the number of columns this {{htmlelement("col")}} or {{htmlelement("colgroup")}} must span; this lets the column occupy space across multiple columns of the table. It reflects the span attribute.
HTMLTableColElementSpan.value:
A positive number representing the number of columns.
NOTEWhen setting a new value, the value is clamped to the nearest strictly positive number (up to 1000).

HTMLTableColElementVAlign.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The vAlign property of the interface is a string indicating how to vertically align text in a table {{htmlelement("col")}} column element.

blockquote.para: This property is deprecated, and CSS should be used to align text vertically in a column. Use the CSS vertical-align property, which takes precedence, to vertically align text in each column cell instead.
As td are not children of col, you can't set it directly on a col element, you need to select the cells of the column using a td:nth-child(n) or similar (n is the column number).
